revised_title: Investigations of Specific Heats in Various Substances Using Liquid Hydrogen and Air Calorimeters
tldr: The author, Sir James Dewar, conducted experiments using liquid hydrogen and air calorimeters to measure the specific heat of various substances, such as diamond, graphite, and ice. The results showed that the specific heat of diamond decreased to 1/19 and graphite to 1/10 between ordinary temperatures and the boiling point of hydrogen. The study also revealed that the specific heat of graphite was about three times that of the diamond at the lowest temperatures.
